poem:
### A Warning's Echo

In The Hague's echo,  
a rogue seeks shadows,  
pleas like petals scatter—  
law's cold embrace,  
a dance of ghosts  
and gavel's grace.  
Once fear's maestro,  
now bound, the world watches—  
a silent warning  
whispers beneath  
a court's weighty breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on Rodrigo Duterte in The Hague: a warning to rogue leaders | Editorial After his arrest on an international criminal court (ICC) warrant on Tuesday, the former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, demonstrated an uncharacteristic concern for due legal process. A petition was unsuccessfully filed to his country’s supreme court to stay his extradition, as lawyers challenged the ICC’s jurisdiction, and pleas were made for any trial to take place in a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
